description: This course teaches IT professionals how to provision and manage services in Microsoft Azure. You will learn how to implement infrastructure components such as virtual networks, virtual machines, containers, web and mobile apps, and storage in Azure. You will also learn how to plan for and manage Azure AD, and configure Azure AD integration with on-premises Active Directory domains.
descriptionMD: This course teaches IT professionals how to provision and manage services in Microsoft Azure. You will learn how to implement infrastructure components such as virtual networks, virtual machines, containers, web and mobile apps, and storage in Azure. You will also learn how to plan for and manage Azure AD, and configure Azure AD integration with on-premises Active Directory domains.
name: Implementing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure - 70-533
subtitle: Microsoft Azure

episodes.description: This course teaches IT professionals how to provision and manage services in Microsoft Azure. You will learn how to implement infrastructure components such as virtual networks, virtual machines, containers, web and mobile apps, and storage in Azure. You will also learn how to plan for and manage Azure AD, and configure Azure AD integration with on-premises Active Directory domains.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.640
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:05.640 --> 00:00:10.005
In this episode we'd like to take a few
moments to show you what you can expect in

3
00:00:10.005 --> 00:00:11.738
an upcoming 7533 series.

4
00:00:11.738 --> 00:00:15.445
That's right, the implementing Microsoft
Azure Infrastructure Solutions and

5
00:00:15.445 --> 00:00:18.000
here to tell us a little
more is Adam Gordon.

6
00:00:18.000 --> 00:00:20.430
>> Hey everybody.
So we're looking forward to spending time

7
00:00:20.430 --> 00:00:23.845
with you and going through all of
the rich and detailed complexity.

8
00:00:23.845 --> 00:00:24.705
And I'm not kidding about that.

9
00:00:24.705 --> 00:00:26.389
You'll see in just a minute what I mean,

10
00:00:26.389 --> 00:00:29.622
with regards to implementing
Microsoft Azure Infrastructures Solutions.

11
00:00:29.622 --> 00:00:30.197
Join me here.

12
00:00:30.197 --> 00:00:33.500
Take a quick look at what we're gonna
expect and what we're gonna be doing.

13
00:00:33.500 --> 00:00:35.040
We spend our time together.

14
00:00:35.040 --> 00:00:38.340
So, let's scroll down here.

15
00:00:38.340 --> 00:00:42.664
And we have and there's quite
a number of them as you can see.

16
00:00:42.664 --> 00:00:46.938
Eight exam objective categories all up
that make up the body of knowledge for

17
00:00:46.938 --> 00:00:47.620
this exam.

18
00:00:47.620 --> 00:00:49.346
We'll be going in depth into each of them.

19
00:00:49.346 --> 00:00:52.017
Designing and
implementing Azure App Service apps,

20
00:00:52.017 --> 00:00:53.923
everything web app service related.

21
00:00:53.923 --> 00:00:56.868
Creating and managing
Resource Manager Virtual Machines.

22
00:00:56.868 --> 00:00:59.340
ARM, as we say, Azure Resource Manager.

23
00:00:59.340 --> 00:01:02.738
ARM VMs, everything you ever wanted to
know and probably a bunch of stuff you

24
00:01:02.738 --> 00:01:05.405
don't care to know about how
you spin up virtual machines.

25
00:01:05.405 --> 00:01:08.901
Notice that is up to 20 to
25% of the overall exam.

26
00:01:08.901 --> 00:01:11.633
Very, very big topical area.

27
00:01:11.633 --> 00:01:14.092
Designing and
implementing a storage strategy,

28
00:01:14.092 --> 00:01:18.133
everything about storage services, the
four kinds of storage services we have,

29
00:01:18.133 --> 00:01:21.180
the two kinds of storage
accounts that we can create.

30
00:01:21.180 --> 00:01:24.350
Implementing virtual networks also
very detailed, very important.

31
00:01:24.350 --> 00:01:30.099
Everything about V-Nets, subnets VPNs,
express route, user defined routes,

32
00:01:30.099 --> 00:01:35.517
etc., as we set up our connectivity to
communicate both within the Azure data

33
00:01:35.517 --> 00:01:41.455
center and between the Azure data center
and potentially are on OnPrem environment.

34
00:01:41.455 --> 00:01:43.059
Designing and deploying ARM Templates.

35
00:01:43.059 --> 00:01:47.649
We're gonna talk about how we can automate
the deployment of resources using

36
00:01:47.649 --> 00:01:51.250
Azure-based resource templates
that are in a JSON format,

37
00:01:51.250 --> 00:01:53.830
Javascript Object Notation form.

38
00:01:53.830 --> 00:01:56.700
Managing Azure Security and
Recovery Services.

39
00:01:56.700 --> 00:01:59.980
Up to 25% to 30% of the overall exam.

40
00:01:59.980 --> 00:02:03.572
The single largest exam
objective by weight over all.

41
00:02:03.572 --> 00:02:05.903
We're gonna take a look at
the Azure Security Center.

42
00:02:05.903 --> 00:02:08.885
Talk about recovery capabilities and
BCDR and

43
00:02:08.885 --> 00:02:12.585
high availability solutions
throughout the platform.

44
00:02:12.585 --> 00:02:16.257
Managing Azure operations and
managing Azure identities.

45
00:02:16.257 --> 00:02:21.324
5 to 10% each, small in terms of
just the number but deceptively so.

46
00:02:21.324 --> 00:02:24.748
Quite a bit of very detailed and
useful and important information and

47
00:02:24.748 --> 00:02:28.760
concepts that are gonna stitch together
our ability to use all those other topics

48
00:02:28.760 --> 00:02:29.897
and understand them.

49
00:02:29.897 --> 00:02:34.402
So a lot of stuff to come,
ultimately probably well over 100

50
00:02:34.402 --> 00:02:39.510
episodes of information that you'll
be able to access and go through.

51
00:02:39.510 --> 00:02:44.615
You're gonna see Wes, among many other
hosts join me here for this voyage.

52
00:02:44.615 --> 00:02:49.050
We're gonna have Cherokee doing some stuff
with us, Mike doing some stuff with us,

53
00:02:49.050 --> 00:02:52.251
Daniel and Ronnie doing some
stuff with us, along with Wes.

54
00:02:52.251 --> 00:02:56.073
I think we've got just about every host
in the building coming in for one or

55
00:02:56.073 --> 00:02:57.378
more of these episodes.

56
00:02:57.378 --> 00:03:00.498
We're bringing everybody in trying
to make it as great as we can and

57
00:03:00.498 --> 00:03:01.454
all encompassing.

58
00:03:01.454 --> 00:03:05.388
Also keep in mind that this episode,
I'm gonna go back to my screen for

59
00:03:05.388 --> 00:03:06.262
just a minute.

60
00:03:06.262 --> 00:03:10.812
Microsoft does update from time
to time the exam objectives

61
00:03:10.812 --> 00:03:14.907
especially in a cloud related
service such as Azure.

62
00:03:14.907 --> 00:03:19.954
You could say and indeed see the same
thing in the Office 365 shows with Ronnie.

63
00:03:19.954 --> 00:03:23.000
The 346 and 347 exams, you could say and

64
00:03:23.000 --> 00:03:27.079
see the same thing in Windows 10,
in server 2016 area.

65
00:03:27.079 --> 00:03:31.561
But especially in the Windows 10
area as it starts to verge into

66
00:03:31.561 --> 00:03:35.964
services related to Azure in the 7697 and
7698 exams.

67
00:03:35.964 --> 00:03:40.631
And the shows that are aligned with
those that Mike and Cherokee and

68
00:03:40.631 --> 00:03:45.396
Ronnie and, perhaps Wes and
others may do over time in the library.

69
00:03:45.396 --> 00:03:47.810
We're trying to update them and
keep them relevant and

70
00:03:47.810 --> 00:03:51.011
aligned with the exam objectives
whenever Microsoft does update them,

71
00:03:51.011 --> 00:03:52.958
as we do with all of
our vendor information.

72
00:03:52.958 --> 00:03:57.778
Microsoft most recently as of March
29th of 2018 did announce new

73
00:03:57.778 --> 00:04:02.118
exam objective updates meaning
not the overall 8 categories,

74
00:04:02.118 --> 00:04:06.802
but topical information within
those categories has been updated.

75
00:04:06.802 --> 00:04:09.941
There is an exam change document
that lists those updates,

76
00:04:09.941 --> 00:04:11.776
I'd encourage you to take a look.

77
00:04:11.776 --> 00:04:16.572
In case you haven't seen it the way that
you read that document when you download

78
00:04:16.572 --> 00:04:21.080
it of course and open it up, is that you
will see, if we can get it to come up,

79
00:04:21.080 --> 00:04:23.320
there we go, try that one more time.

80
00:04:23.320 --> 00:04:27.741
That you will find aside from the red
header that tells you when it's effective.

81
00:04:27.741 --> 00:04:32.270
That Microsoft, may cross out something
and say that was create and something and

82
00:04:32.270 --> 00:04:36.090
now it's a and, those are minor,
you don't care about those changes.

83
00:04:36.090 --> 00:04:39.873
Configure apps instead of web apps,
same thing, you don't care about that.

84
00:04:39.873 --> 00:04:45.278
But when you see something
that is added in either in

85
00:04:45.278 --> 00:04:50.315
purple like it is here and
or in red as it is here.

86
00:04:50.315 --> 00:04:52.235
Those are changes that have been made and

87
00:04:52.235 --> 00:04:54.503
additions that have been
made by topical area.

88
00:04:54.503 --> 00:04:58.954
And you can see as you go through there
are quite a number of them in some areas,

89
00:04:58.954 --> 00:05:02.000
some areas have had no
changes as you can see.

90
00:05:02.000 --> 00:05:05.311
And we go through and
address all these changes for you.

91
00:05:05.311 --> 00:05:10.156
And the reason we're pointing this out,
is that this set of episodes,

92
00:05:10.156 --> 00:05:14.921
this show, has been shot and
updated to include all those changes that

93
00:05:14.921 --> 00:05:18.996
were announced late in March,
early in April of 2018.

94
00:05:18.996 --> 00:05:21.957
We've put together this
content over several months,

95
00:05:21.957 --> 00:05:25.611
the most recent additions that are in
that document are being shot and

96
00:05:25.611 --> 00:05:28.761
put together for you up to and
including right into the end of

97
00:05:28.761 --> 00:05:32.740
May of 2018 as all these features
have gone live and become available.

98
00:05:32.740 --> 00:05:34.878
We've scaled them in as necessary.

99
00:05:34.878 --> 00:05:39.862
So this set of shows, you're gonna look at
both here and in 7535 show if you choose

100
00:05:39.862 --> 00:05:44.501
to go there for architecting, have been
made up to date and are the absolute most

101
00:05:44.501 --> 00:05:49.600
recent Azure content you can access,
given most recent exam objective changes.

102
00:05:49.600 --> 00:05:50.454
So just be aware of that,

103
00:05:50.454 --> 00:05:52.501
make sure you pay attention to
everything as we go through.

104
00:05:52.501 --> 00:05:56.763
We look forward to seeing you in those
episodes and hope at the end of this

105
00:05:56.763 --> 00:06:00.600
process you are successful at
certifying either as an MCSA and or

106
00:06:00.600 --> 00:06:02.321
an MCSC in Microsoft Cloud.

107
00:06:02.321 --> 00:06:07.518
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel overview the Microsoft Azure platform. They discuss how to sign into the Azure Portal and the different types of Microsoft accounts.
episodes.title: Introduction to Microsoft Azure

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel overview the Microsoft Azure platform. They discuss he three built-in account and subscription-level administrative roles. In ddition, they preview the various Azure management tools and the powershell odule required to manage Azure. The steps involved to setup and configure the zurerm module for poweshell are also demonstrated.
episodes.title: Introduction to Microsoft Azure Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel overview the Microsoft Azure platform. They discuss the Azure Automation Authoring Toolkit. In addition, they demonstrate the two different approaches for authenticating into the Azure Resource Management portal, using Azure AD Authentication and / or the Add-AzureRmAccount cmdlet through powershell. They also discuss how to use Azure CLI.
episodes.title: Introduction to Microsoft Azure Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel overview the Microsoft Azure platform. They discuss certificate-based authentication with the Azure Portal.
episodes.title: Introduction to Microsoft Azure Part 4

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel overview the Microsoft Azure platform. They discuss the use of Azure Resource Manager templates.
episodes.title: Introduction to Microsoft Azure Part 5

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what Azure virtual networks are. They also discuss what the private IP address ranges are for use in Azure, as well as the importance of subnets, and DNS.
episodes.title: Azure Virtual Network Overview

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. They also discuss what options we have to establish and control virtual network connectivity when computers that are not connected directly to the same virtual network, and reside outside Azure need to communicate. These options include using a point-to-site VPN, site-to-site VPN, and Azure ExpressRoute. They also discuss what options we have when computers reside on another Azure virtual network, and describe using VNET peering and Vnet-to-Vnet connections.
episodes.title: Azure Virtual Network Overview Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. They also discuss what Network Interfaces are, and how to create a nic using powershell. In addition, they discuss what a Private IP address is and how they are assigned in Azure. They also discuss all of the building block components of the virtual network configuration such as Network Security Groups, Resource Groups and subnets. Adam begins to demonstrate how to use powershell to create a virtual network.
episodes.title: Azure Virtual Network Overview Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam continues to demonstrate how to use powershell to create a virtual network and deploy a Windows Server 2016 VM into the network. They also discuss what the different pricing tiers and options are for the Azure platform VM's.
episodes.title: Creating a VNet

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam finishes up the demonstration of how to use powershell to create a virtual network and deploy a Windows Server 2016 VM into the network.
episodes.title: Creating a VNet Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam overviews the types of Azure Load Balancers and describes what they are used for.
episodes.title: Load Balancers

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam begins to demonstrate how to deploy an internet facing load balancer.
episodes.title: Load Balancers Part 2

episodes.description:
Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are.
Adam begins to demonstrate how to deploy an internet facing load balancer.
episodes.title: Load Balancers Part 3

episodes.description:
Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are.
Adam finishes up his demonstration of how to deploy an internet facing load
balancer.
episodes.title: Load Balancers Part 4

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what an Azure Application Gateway is, and what they are used for. Adam and Daniel examine the differences between the Azure Traffic Manager, Azure Application Gateway and the Azure Load Balancer. Adam begins a demonstration using both the Azure Resource Manager Portal and Powershell to create and configure an Application Gateway.
episodes.title: Application Gateways

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam finishes up the demonstration using both the Azure Resource Manager Portal and Powershell to create and configure an Application Gateway.
episodes.title: Application Gateways Part 2

episodes.description:
Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what a Web Application Firewall (WAF) is used for. Adam and Daniel also discuss the two different modes that a WAF can be configured to operate in. Adam demonstrates how to convert an existing Application Gateway into a WAF using both the ARM portal and powershell. Adam also discusses how to deploy a AF
from scratch using powershell.
episodes.title: Web Application Firewalls (WAF)

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what Azure DNS is used for. Adam and Daniel also discuss the importance of registering the microsoft.network resource provider in order to be able to use Azure DNS with your subscription. Adam demonstrates how to setup and configure Azure DNS using both the ARM portal and powershell.
episodes.title: Azure DNS

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what User Defined Routes are used for. Adam begins to demonstrate how to setup and configure User Defined Rotes using both the ARM portal and powershell.
episodes.title: User Defined Routes (UDR)

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what User Defined Routes are used for. Adam continues to demonstrate how to setup and configure User Defined Rotes using both the ARM portal and powershell.
episodes.title: User Defined Routes (UDR) Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what User Defined Routes are used for. Adam finishes up the demonstration of how to setup and configure User Defined Rotes using both the ARM portal and powershell. Adam also uses the CloudShell and Azure CLI to configure two Windows Server 2016 VM's and then use them to help test the user defined routes created. Adam also creates a Network Watcher node and uses it to help test the user defined routes.
episodes.title: User Defined Routes (UDR) Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what direct server return is and how to leverage this feature of Azure virtual networking through the Azure Load Balancer.
episodes.title: Direct Server Return

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what virtual network peering is and how to leverage this feature of Azure virtual networking. Adam demonstrates how to enable vnet peering through both the ARM portal and powershell.
episodes.title: VNet Peering

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what configuration management is and how to leverage this concept with Azure virtual networking by using a platform such as Puppet. Adam demonstrates how to use the Puppet Enterprise template to deploy a Puppet solution both the ARM portal and powershell.
episodes.title: Configuration Management with Puppet

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss how to use the Cloud Shell and Azure CLI to create and deploy a Load Balancer and associated VNet. Adam uses the Cloud Shell with Azure CLI to create a Resource Group, Public IP and Load Balancer. He then creates a Health Probe, Load Balancer Rule to manage traffic, and configures the VNet. Once all of that is done, Adam creates three virtual NICs and uses a cloud-init.txt file to customize the deployment of three VMs into the backend pool for the lad balancer.
episodes.title: Create Load Balancer and VNet in Azure CLI

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss how to use the Cloud Shell and Azure CLI to create and deploy a Load Balancer and associated VNet. Adam uses the Cloud Shell with Azure CLI to create a Resource Group, Public IP and Load Balancer. He then creates a Health Probe, Load Balancer Rule to manage traffic, and configures the VNet. Once all of that is done, Adam creates three virtual NICs and uses a cloud-init.txt file to customize the deployment of three VMs into the backend pool for the lad balancer.
episodes.title: Create Load Balancer and VNet in Azure CLI Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses how to create a VM and assign a static public IP address to it. Adam demonstrates how to create the VM using both the ARM portal and powershell.
episodes.title: Configure a VM with a Static Public IP

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses how to create a VM and assign a static public IP address to it. Adam finishes up the demonstration of how to create the VM using both the ARM portal and powershell.
episodes.title: Configure a VM with a Static Public IP Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses how to create a VM and assign a static private IP address to it. Adam demonstrates how to create the VM using both the ARM portal and powershell.
episodes.title: Configure a VM with a Private IP

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what a Network Security Group is used for, and why we would want to associate a virtual machine with a Network Security Group. Adam demonstrates how to create the Network Security Group using the ARM portal.
episodes.title: VMs and Network Security Groups

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what an Application Gateway is used for, and why we would want to associate a virtual machine with an Application Gateway. Adam demonstrates how to create the Application Gateway using the ARM portal.
episodes.title: Virtual Machines and Application Gateways

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what an Application Gateway is used for, and why we would want to associate a virtual machine with an Application Gateway. Adam finishes demonstrating how to create the Application Gateway using the ARM portal.
episodes.title: Virtual Machines and Application Gateways Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what a Point-to-Site (P2S) VPN is used for. Adam demonstrates how to setup and configure the Point-to-Site (P2S) VPN using the both powershell and the ARM portal.
episodes.title: Point to Site VPN

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what a Point-to-Site (P2S) VPN is used for. Adam demonstrates how to setup and configure the Point-to-Site (P2S) VPN using the both powershell and the ARM portal.
episodes.title: Point to Site VPN Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what a Site-to-Site (S2S) VPN is used for. Adam demonstrates how to setup and configure the Site-to-Site (S2S) VPN using the both powershell and the ARM portal.
episodes.title: Site to Site VPN

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what forced tunneling is used for. Adam demonstrates how to setup and configure forced tunneling using both powershell and the ARM portal.
episodes.title: Forced Tunneling

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what a VNet-to-VNet VPN Gateway is used for. Adam demonstrates how to setup and configure a VNet-to-VNet VPN Gateway using both powershell and the ARM portal.
episodes.title: VNet-to-VNet VPN Gateway

episodes.description: dam and Ronnie continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what a VNet-to-VNet VPN Gateway is used for. Adam demonstrates how to setup and configure a VNet-to-VNet VPN Gateway using both powershell and the ARM portal.
episodes.title: VNet-to-VNet VPN Gateway Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie continue to discuss what Azure virtual networks are. Adam discusses what ExpressRoute is used for. In addition, Adam demonstrates where to go to configure an ExpressRoute VPN Gateway using the ARM portal.
episodes.title: Configure ExpressRoute connectivity

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss what an Azure VM is. They also discuss and identify what workloads can and cannot be deployed into Azure.
episodes.title: Identifying Worklods for Azure VMs

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what an Azure workload is. They also discuss and identify what is reqired to deploy and run a workload in Azure using Windows and Linux Vms.
episodes.title: Deploy and Run Workloads for Azure VMs

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss what an Azure VM is. They also discuss how to deploy a VM into the Azure Portal. Adam demonstrates how to use the Azure Portal to deploy a Windows Server 2016 VM.
episodes.title: Create and Connect to VMs

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss what an Azure VM is. They also discuss how to deploy a VM into the Azure Portal. Adam demonstrates how to use PowerShell to deploy a Windows Server 2016 VM.
episodes.title: Create and Connect to VMs Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss what an Azure VM is. They also discuss how to deploy a VM into the Azure Portal. Adam demonstrates how to use PowerShell to deploy a Windows Server 2016 VM.
episodes.title: Create and Connect to VMs Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss what an Azure VM is. They also discuss how to deploy a VM into the Azure Portal by using a pre-created image. Adam demonstrates how to use PowerShell to capture an image of an existing VM, and then uses the portal to deploy a Windows Server 2016 VM from the image.
episodes.title: Create and Connect to VMs Part 4

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss what an Azure VM is. They also discuss what the Cloud Shell is. Adam demonstrates how to use the Cloud Shell and Azure CLI to deploy an UBUNTU Linux VM. He also demonstrates how to allow connectivity over a specific port via a public IP address as well as how to update and install a package on the Linux VM.
episodes.title: Create and Connect to VMs Part 5

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss what an Azure VM is. They also discuss what the Cloud Shell is. Adam demonstrates how to use the Cloud Shell and Azure CLI to deploy an UBUNTU Linux VM.
episodes.title: Create and Connect to VMs Part 6

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss what an Azure VM is. They also discuss how to deploy a VM into the Azure Portal by using a pre-created image. Adam demonstrates how to use Cloud Shell to capture an image of an existing VM, and then uses Cloud Shell to deploy a Linux VM from the image.
episodes.title: Create and Connect to VMs Part 7

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss what an Azure VM availability set is. They also discuss how to deploy a VM and create an availability set using the Azure Portal.
episodes.title: Manage ARM VM Availability

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss what an Azure VM availability set is. They also discuss how to deploy a VM and create an availability set using the Azure Portal.
episodes.title: Manage ARM VM Availability Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss what an Azure VM availability set is. They also discuss how to deploy a VM and create an availability set using Cloud Shell.
episodes.title: Manage ARM VM Availability Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss the things necessary to be able to plan storage capacity accurately for Azure VMs, including what virtual machine storage is. They examine the different types of data storage associated with an Azure Storage Account. In addition, they discuss the differences between the Standard and Premium storage options and unmanaged and managed disks.
episodes.title: Plan Storage Capacity and Create VMs

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss the things necessary to be able to plan storage capacity accurately for Azure VMs, including what virtual machine storage is. They examine the different types of data storage associated with an Azure Storage Account. In addition, they discuss the differences between the Standard and Premium storage options and unmanaged and managed disks.
episodes.title: Plan Storage Capacity and Create VMs Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss the things necessary to be able to plan storage capacity accurately for Azure VMs, including what virtual machine storage is. They examine the different types of data storage associated with an Azure Storage Account. In addition, they discuss how to add a data disk to a VM and how to take a snapshot of an existing VM. Adam uses the ARM Portal to demonstrate how to work with disks.
episodes.title: Plan Storage Capacity and Create VMs Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel examine the different types of replication options associated with an Azure Storage Account. Adam uses the ARM Portal to demonstrate how to modify the replication choice on an existing storage account, as well as creating a new storage account. They also examine the host disk caching settings on a VM disk.
episodes.title: Disk Caching, Redundancy and Geo-Replication

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what geo-replication is and how to configure it. In addition, Adam uses the both powershell and the ARM Portal to demonstrate how to build out a two SQL server geo-replicated failover solution.
episodes.title: Disk Caching, Redundancy and Geo-Replication Pt.2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what geo-replication is and how to configure it. In addition, Adam uses the both powershell and the ARM Portal to demonstrate how to build out a two SQL server geo-replicated failover solution.
episodes.title: Disk Caching, Redundancy and Geo-Replication Pt.3

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what the Azure File Service is and how to configure it. In addition, Adam uses both powershell and the ARM Portal to demonstrate how to setup and configure a file share using the Azure File Service.
episodes.title: Shared Storage with Azure File Service

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what an Azure File Share snapshot is and how to create one. In addition, Adam uses both cloud shell and the ARM Portal to demonstrate how to create a file share snapshot.
episodes.title: Configure Azure File Share Snapshots

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what the Azure Key Vault is, and why you need one to enable encryption for an Azure VM. In addition, Adam uses both powershell and the ARM Portal to demonstrate how to setup and configure a key vault. Adam then enables encryption on a VM and demonstrates how to validate that encryption has been successfully configured for the VM.
episodes.title: Encrypt Disks

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what the Azure Key Vault is, and why you need one to enable encryption for an Azure VM. In addition, Adam uses both powershell and the ARM Portal to demonstrate how to setup and configure a key vault. Adam then enables encryption on a VM and demonstrates how to validate that encryption has been successfully configured for the VM.
episodes.title: Encrypt Disks Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what the Azure Key Vault is, and why you need one to enable encryption for an Azure VM. In addition, Adam uses both powershell and the ARM Portal to demonstrate how to setup and configure a key vault. Adam then enables encryption on a VM and demonstrates how to validate that encryption has been successfully configured for the VM.
episodes.title: Encrypt Disks Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Wes discuss how to configure Blob-Level Tiering (Hot, Cool, Archive) and how to manage storage encryption keys.
episodes.title: Blob Level Tiering and Storage Encryption Keys

episodes.description: dam and Daniel discuss what an Azure workload is. They also discuss and identify what is required to deploy and run a workload in Azure using Windows and Linux VMs.
episodes.title: Deploy Bring Your Own License (BYOL) Images

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what an Azure workload is. They also discuss and identify what is required to deploy and run a workload in Azure using Windows and Linux VMs.
episodes.title: Deploy Bring Your Own License (BYOL) Images Pt.2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss how to create and deploy an ARM VM Scale Set. In addition, Adam uses both the Cloud Shell and the ARM Portal to demonstrate how to setup and configure a VMSS using both Windows Server and Linux VMs.
episodes.title: Create and Deploy ARM VM Scale Sets (VMSS)

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss how to create and deploy an ARM VM Scale Set. In addition, Adam uses both the Cloud Shell and the ARM Portal to demonstrate how to setup and configure a VMSS using both Windows Server and Linux VMs.
episodes.title: Create and Deploy ARM VM Scale Sets (VMSS) Pt.2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss how to create and deploy an ARM VM Scale Set. In addition, Adam uses both the Cloud Shell and the ARM Portal to demonstrate how to setup and configure a VMSS using both Windows Server and Linux VMs.
episodes.title: Create and Deploy ARM VM Scale Sets (VMSS) Pt.3

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what the VM Agent is and why it is required to enable VM extensions. Adam demonstrates how to see if the VM Agent is installed on a VM already, and how to download and install the VM Agent manually if necessary. Adam also discusses what VM extensions are and how to deploy the Microsoft IaaS Anti-malware extension to a Windows Server 2016 VM.
episodes.title: Perform Configuration Management

episodes.description:
Adam and Daniel discuss what the VM Agent is and why it is required to enable VM extensions. Adam discusses how to deploy the CustomScript extension to a Windows Server 2016 VM. Adam then uses the CustomScript extension with a
powershell script to create and place a file on a Windows Server 2016 VM remotely.
episodes.title: Perform Configuration Management Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what the VM Agent is and why it is required to enable VM extensions. Adam discusses how to deploy the Powershell DSC extension to a Windows Server 2016 VM. Adam then uses the Powershell DSC extension with a powershell script to install and configure IIS on a Windows Server 2016 VM remotely.
episodes.title: Perform Configuration Management Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what the different options are that can be used to monitor infrastructure in the Azure Portal. Adam demonstrates the Overview monitoring scorecards that a VM displays by default. In addition, Adam also examines and demonstrates the Metrics monitoring capabilities that are available for a VM.
episodes.title: Monitor ARM VMs

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what the different options are that can be used to monitor infrastructure in the Azure Portal. Adam demonstrates the various options available under the Monitoring category for a VM including Diagnostics settings, Advisor recommendations, and Diagram. In addition, Adam also examines and  demonstrates the Support & Troubleshooting monitoring capabilities that are available for a VM.
episodes.title: Monitor ARM VMs Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what the different options are that can be used to monitor infrastructure in the Azure Portal. Adam demonstrates the Alert Rules options available under the Monitoring category for a VM.
episodes.title: Monitor ARM VMs Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what the Azure Container Service is. Adam discusses what Docker is and why you would use Docker as a containerized hosting solution to run one or more applications. Adam demonstrates how to download and install Docker for Windows and once installed how to use the Docker environment to host an application on a Windows 10 machine.
episodes.title: Manage with Azure Container Services (ACS)

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what the Azure Container Registry is.
episodes.title: Manage with Azure Container Services (ACS) Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what a Kubernetes Cluster is. Adam uses CloudShell and Azure CLI to deploy a Kubernetes Cluster.
episodes.title: Manage with Azure Container Services (ACS) Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what a Kubernetes Cluster is. Adam uses CloudShell and Azure CLI to deploy a Kubernetes Cluster. Run applications in Kubernetes.
episodes.title: Manage with Azure Container Services (ACS) Part 4

episodes.description:
Adam and Daniel discuss what a Kubernetes Cluster is. Adam uses
CloudShell and Azure CLI to deploy a Kubernetes Cluster. Run applications in Kubernetes.
episodes.title: Manage with Azure Container Services (ACS) Part 5

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what how to monitor a Kubernetes Cluster with OMS. Adam uses the Azure Portal and Azure CLI to deploy and configure an OMS workspace and attach the Linux Agents that are part of the Kubernetes Cluster to the workspace for monitoring.
episodes.title: Manage with Azure Container Services (ACS) Part 6

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss the differences associated with using Azure Container Services (AKS) to create a Kubernetes Cluster.
episodes.title: Manage with Azure Container Services (ACS) Part 7

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss how to create and deploy a Docker Swarm and a DC/OS cluster using Azure CLI.
episodes.title: Manage with Azure Container Services (ACS) Part 8

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what an ARM template is and how to automate resource deployments using ARM templates. Adam discusses what the required and optional components of a template file are. In addition, Adam uses powershell to complete an ARM template deployment of an Azure Storage Account.
episodes.title: Implement ARM Templates

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what an ARM template is and how to automate resource deployments using ARM templates. Adam uses Visual Studio 2017 to complete an ARM template deployment of an Windows Server VM.
episodes.title: Implement ARM Templates Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what an ARM template is and how to automate resource deployments using ARM templates. Adam uses the Quick Start GitHub template repository to demonstrate an ARM template deployment of an Azure Storage Account. Adam also discusses how to use Azure CLI and the ARM REST API to accomplish ARM template based deployments.
episodes.title: Implement ARM Templates Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what the Azure Active Directory (AAD) is. Adam also discusses what the high-level steps necessary to setup authentication are. Adam discusses what a Service Principal is, and what the uses for a Service Principal may be.
episodes.title: Control Access

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what an Azure Service Principal is. Adam demonstrates how to create a Service Principal using Powershell.
episodes.title: Control Access Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what a Service Principal is. Adam demonstrates how to create a Service Principal with a self-signed certificate using PowerShell. Adam also discusses how to create a Service Principal with a certificate from a CA.
episodes.title: Control Access Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what Azure policy is. Adam discusses the differences between an Azure Policy assignment and an Initiative Definition, and demonstrates how to create them via the Azure Portal.
episodes.title: Control Access Part 4

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what Azure policy is. Adam discusses the differences between an Azure Policy assignment and an Initiative Definition, and demonstrates how to create them via PowerShell.
episodes.title: Control Access Part 5

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss how to design an Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) strategy for Azure infrastructure. Adam uses both Azure Portal and PowerShell to examine how to uses existing roles and create custom roles.
episodes.title: Design Role-Based Access Control

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what the Azure Blob Storage service is, and how to implement Blob and File storage services through a storage account. Adam discusses what the three different types of storage accounts are, and what the default endpoints for a storage account are.
episodes.title: Implement Storage Blobs and Files

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what the Azure Blob Storage service is, and how to implement Blob and File storage services through a storage account. Adam discusses what the three different types of storage accounts are, and what the default endpoints for a storage account are. Adam also discusses what the three different types of storage blobs are. Adam demonstrates how to create storage accounts using the Azure Portal.
episodes.title: Implement Storage Blobs and Files Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what the Azure Blob Storage service is, and how to implement Blob and File storage services through a storage account. Adam discusses what the three different types of storage accounts are, and what the default endpoints for a storage account are. Adam also discusses what the three different types of storage blobs are. Adam demonstrates how to create storage accounts using the Azure Portal.
episodes.title: Implement Storage Blobs and Files Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what the Azure Blob Storage service is, and how to implement Blob and File storage services through a storage account. Adam discusses what the three different types of storage accounts are, and what the default endpoints for a storage account are. Adam also discusses what the three different types of storage blobs are. Adam demonstrates how to create storage accounts using the Azure Portal.
episodes.title: Implement Storage Blobs and Files Part 4

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what the Azure Blob Storage service is, and how to implement Blob and File storage services through a storage account. Adam discusses what the three different types of storage accounts are, and what the default endpoints for a storage account are. Adam also discusses what the three different types of storage blobs are. Adam demonstrates how to create storage accounts using the Azure Portal.
episodes.title: Implement Storage Blobs and Files Part 5

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what a stored access policy and a shared access signature are. Adam uses both PowerShell and the Azure Portal to demonstrate how to create a stored access policy and a shared access signature to control access to blob data.
episodes.title: Implement Storage Blobs and Files Part 6

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what a stored access policy and a shared access signature are. Adam uses both PowerShell and the Azure Portal to demonstrate how to create a stored access policy and a shared access signature to control access to blob data.
episodes.title: Implement Storage Blobs and Files Part 7

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what options are available for storage logging and accessing log data in the Azure portal. Adam demonstrates how to enable the various monitoring and diagnostics options for the storage services of a general storage account.
episodes.title: Diagnostics, Monitoring and Analytics

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what a StorSimple Virtual Array is and the requirements for use and deployment of the array. Adam uses the Azure Portal to setup a resource group, a storage account and an instance of the StorSimple Device Manager to bein the deployment and configuration of the virtual array.
episodes.title: Implement Azure StorSimple

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what a StorSimple Virtual Array is and the requirements for use and deployment of the array. Adam uses the Azure Portal to finish the deployment and configuration of the SimpleStor Array as an iSCSI Server.
episodes.title: Implement Azure StorSimple Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what a StorSimple Virtual Array is and the requirements for use and deployment of the array. Adam uses the Azure Portal to download the .VHDX appliance file and then walks through the setup and configuration of the array VM in Windows Server 2016 Hyper-V.
episodes.title: Implement Azure StorSimple Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what storage service encryption (SSE) is and how to enable this feature on a storage account. Adam uses the Azure Portal to enable Azure SSE for the blob and file services on a general storage account, and also uses the Storage Explorer tool to examine data decryption on demand.
episodes.title: Implement Storage Encryption

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what the Azure Data Lake Store is and why you may want to implement it. Adam uses the Azure Portal to create an Azure Data Lake Store and then examines the settings associated with it. In addition, Adam demonstrates how to use role based security for data managed by the Data Lake Store.
episodes.title: Implement Storage Encryption Part 2

topics.title: Design and Implement a Storage Strategy

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what the Azure Key Vault is and why you may want to implement it. Adam uses the Azure Portal to create an Azure Key Vault and then examines the settings associated with it. In addition, Adam demonstrates how to create and work with keys, certificates and secrets in the Key Vault via the Azure Portal.
episodes.title: Create and Import Encryption Keys with Key Vault

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what the Azure Key Vault is and why you may want to implement it. Adam uses PowerShell to create an Azure Key Vault and then examines the settings associated with it. In addition, Adam demonstrates how to create and work with keys, certificates and secrets in the Key Vault via PowerShell.
episodes.title: Create and Import Encryption Keys with Key Vault 2

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what the Azure Security Center is and why you may want to use it. Adam demonstrates how to use the Azure security center's features to allow you prevent and respond to a variety of security threats.
episodes.title: Azure Security Center

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what application access using Single Sign-On with Azure Active Directory is. Adam uses the Azure Portal to upgrade the Azure Active Directory subscription from free to premium, and then uses the enhanced features of the premium tier to install and configure several Enterprise Applications that are capable of supporting Single Sign-On.
episodes.title: Manage Data Protection and Security Compliance

episodes.description:
Adam and Cherokee discuss what application access using Single Sign-On with Azure Active Directory is. Adam uses the Azure Portal to demonstrate how to enable automated provisioning and deprovisioning of users accounts to SaaS applications. Adam also discusses and demonstrates how to configure federation with public consumer identity providers such as Facebook
and Google.
episodes.title: Manage Data Protection and Security Compliance Pt2

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what the Azure Backup Vault / Azure Recovery Service is and why you may want to use it. Adam uses the Azure Portal to demonstrate how to use the Azure Backup Vault's features.
episodes.title: Implement Recovery Services

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what the Azure Backup Vault / Azure Recovery Service is and why you may want to use it. Adam uses the Azure Portal to demonstrate how to use the Azure Backup Vault's features.
episodes.title: Implement Recovery Services Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what the Azure Backup Vault / Azure Recovery Service is and why you may want to use it. Adam uses the Azure Portal to demonstrate how to use the Azure Backup Vault's features.
episodes.title: Implement Recovery Services Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what the Azure Backup Vault / Azure Recovery Service is and why you may want to use it. Adam uses the Azure Portal to demonstrate how to use the Azure Recovery Service features to safeguard VMs.
episodes.title: Implement Recovery Services Part 4

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what the Azure Backup Vault / Azure Recovery Service is and why you may want to use it. Adam uses the Azure Portal to demonstrate how to use the Azure Recovery Service features to safeguard VMs.
episodes.title: Implement Recovery Services Part 5

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what the Azure Backup Vault / Azure Recovery Service is and why you may want to use it. Adam uses the Azure Portal to demonstrate how to use the Azure Recovery Service features to safeguard VMs.
episodes.title: Implement Recovery Services Part 6

topics.title: Manage Azure Security and Recovery Services

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what Azure Automation is and why you may want to use it. Adam uses the Azure Portal to demonstrate how to use the Azure Automation features.
episodes.title: Enhance Cloud Management with Automation

episodes.description:
Adam and Mike discuss what the Azure Automation is and why you may
want to use it. Adam uses the Azure Portal and Powershell to demonstrate how to
use the Azure Automation features.
episodes.title: Enhance Cloud Management with Automation Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Mike discuss what the Azure Automation is and why you may want to use it. Adam uses the Azure Portal to demonstrate how to create a Desired State Configuration (DSC) and assign it to a VM.
episodes.title: Enhance Cloud Management with Automation Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Mike discuss what the Azure Automation is and why you may want to use it. Adam uses PowerShell to demonstrate how to create a sample automation environment using a .json template from the Microsoft GitHub repository. Adam also uses PowerShell to configure servers to a desired state and manage drift by using a Desired State Configuration (DSC) and assigning it to a VM.
episodes.title: Enhance Cloud Management with Automation Part 4

episodes.description: Adam and Wes discuss what Azure Serverless computing is and why you may want to use it.
episodes.title: Enhance Cloud Management with Automation Part 5

episodes.description: Adam and Wes discuss what Azure Functions are as a part of Azure Serverless computing and why you may want to use them.
episodes.title: Enhance Cloud Management with Automation Part 6

episodes.description: Adam and Wes discuss what Event Grid is as a part of Azure Serverless computing and why you may want to use it.
episodes.title: Enhance Cloud Management with Automation Part 7

episodes.description: Adam and Wes discuss what the Service Bus is as a part of Azure Serverless computing and why you may want to use it.
episodes.title: Enhance Cloud Management with Automation Part 8

episodes.description: Adam and Mike discuss how to work with data that is in the cloud, on-premise, or in both areas. Adam uses the Azure Portal to demonstrate how to create a Log Analytics service instance and an associated Operations Manager Suite (OMS) Workspace.
episodes.title: Working with data in cloud and on-prem

episodes.description: Adam and Mike discuss how to work with data that is in the cloud, on-premise, or in both areas. Adam uses PowerShell to demonstrate how to create a Log Analytics service instance and an associated Operations Manager Suite (OMS) Workspace.
episodes.title: Working with data in cloud and on-prem Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Mike discuss how to work with data that is in the cloud, on-premise, or in both areas. Adam uses the Azure Portal to demonstrate how to use a Log Analytics service instance and an associated Operations Manager Suite (OMS) Workspace to examine collected log data from multiple VMs. In addition, Adam demonstrates how to use the overview blade for the Log Analytics service to add a solution to the workspace. Adam also demonstrates how to use the Log Search tile to examine captured log data.
episodes.title: Working with data in cloud and on-prem Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Mike discuss how to work with data that is in the cloud, on-premise, or in both areas. Adam uses the Azure Portal to demonstrate how to use a Log Analytics service instance and an associated Operations Manager Suite (OMS) Workspace to examine collected log data from multiple VMs. In addition, Adam demonstrates how to use the overview blade for the Log Analytics service to add a solution to the workspace. Adam also demonstrates how to use the Log Search tile to examine captured log data.
episodes.title: Working with data in cloud and on-prem Part 4

episodes.description: Adam and Mike discuss how to work with data that is in the cloud, on-premise, or in both areas. Adam uses the Azure Portal to demonstrate how to use a Log Analytics service instance and an associated Operations Manager Suite (OMS) Workspace to examine collected log data from multiple VMs. In addition, Adam demonstrates how to create and share a custom dashboard in the Azure Portal and then pin tiles from the OMS workspace to it. Adam also demonstrates how to use the Azure Log Analytics workspace to examine captured log data.
episodes.title: Working with data in cloud and on-prem Part 5

episodes.description: Adam and Wes discuss how to configure the IT Service Management Connector (ITSMC).
episodes.title: Working with data in cloud and on-prem - ITSMC

episodes.description: Adam and Mike discuss what a Web App is and why you would want to create and deploy one. Adam also discusses what a Web App Service Plan is and why we need one to enable deployment and hosting of a Web App in Azure. Adam uses the Azure Portal to examine a deployed Web App and demonstrates how to access the running Web App web site through a browser.
episodes.title: Deploy and Configure Web Apps

episodes.description: Adam and Mike discuss what a Web App is and why you would want to create and deploy one. Adam also discusses what a Web App Service Plan is and why we need one to enable deployment and hosting of a Web App in Azure. Adam uses Visual Studio 2017 to begin the process of creating a new project to build and publish a Web App.
episodes.title: Deploy and Configure Web Apps Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Mike discuss what a Web App is and why you would want to create and deploy one. Adam also discusses what a Web App Service Plan is and why we need one to enable deployment and hosting of a Web App in Azure. Adam uses the Azure Portal to examine a deployed Web App and demonstrates how to access the running Web App web site through a browser.
episodes.title: Deploy and Configure Web Apps Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Mike discuss what a Web App is and why you would want to create and deploy one. Adam also discusses what a Web App Service Plan is and why we need one to enable deployment and hosting of a Web App in Azure. Adam uses the Azure Portal to examine a deployed Web App and demonstrates how to access the running Web App web site through a browser.
episodes.title: Define Deployment Slots

episodes.description: Adam and Mike discuss what a Web App is and why you would want to create and deploy one. Adam also discusses what a Web App Service Plan is and why we need one to enable deployment and hosting of a Web App in Azure. Adam uses the Azure Portal to examine a deployed Web App and demonstrates how to access the running Web App web site through a browser.
episodes.title: Define and Use App Settings

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what a Web App is and why you would want to create and deploy one. Adam also discusses what a Web App Service Plan is and why we need one to enable deployment and hosting of a Web App in Azure. Adam uses the Azure Portal to examine a deployed Web App and demonstrates how to access the running Web App web site through a browser.
episodes.title: Web Apps and App Service Plans

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what a Web App is and why you would want to create and deploy one. Adam also discusses what a Web App Service Plan is and why we need one to enable deployment and hosting of a Web App in Azure. Adam uses the Azure Portal to examine a deployed Web App and demonstrates how to access the running Web App web site through a browser.
episodes.title: Web Apps and App Service Plans Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what a Web App is and why you would want to create and deploy one. Adam also discusses what a Web App Service Plan is and why we need one to enable deployment and hosting of a Web App in Azure. Adam uses the Windows Git Bash client and the .Net Core SDK to create a ASP.NET application. Adam then shows how to use CloudShell and Azure CLI to prepare the application for deployment into the Azure Portal.
episodes.title: Web Apps and App Service Plans Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss how to select and use appropriate deployment methods for web apps including Git, FTP, and cloud sync. In addition, Adam demonstrates how to define and use app settings, connection strings, handlers, and virtual directories; configure certificates and custom domains; configure SSL bindings and runtime configurations through the Azure Portal.
episodes.title: Select Appropriate Deployment Methods

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss how to configure authentication and authorization for Web Apps and configure Web App notifications through the Azure Portal.
episodes.title: Authentication and Authorization for Web Apps

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss how to determine when to use App Service Environment (ASE).
episodes.title: When to use App Service Environment

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss how to determine when to use App Service Environment (ASE) and what the options are for configuring an ASE once it is deployed.
episodes.title: When to use App Service Environment Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss how to use the Monitoring Blade settings to configure diagnostics settings for a Web App. Once the diagnostics settings are configured, Adam then demonstrates how to retrieve diagnostics data, view streaming logs, configure alerts; and monitor Web App resources.
episodes.title: Diagnostics, Monitoring and Analytics

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss how to use powershell to examine log data. Adam demonstrates the use of the Get-AzureRmLog cmdlet as well as the Get-AzureRmDiagnosticSetting and Set-AzureRmDiagnosticSetting cmdlets.
episodes.title: Diagnostics, Monitoring and Analytics Part 2

episodes.description:
Adam and Cherokee discuss how to use the Monitoring Blade settings
to configure diagnostics settings for a Web App. Once the diagnostics settings
are configured, Adam then demonstrates how to retrieve diagnostics data,
view streaming logs, and monitor Web App resources. Adam uses the KUDU
dashboard to examine the web app as well as Visual Studio 2017.
episodes.title: Diagnostics, Monitoring and Analytics Part 3

episodes.description:
dam and Cherokee discuss how to use the Monitoring Blade settings
to configure diagnostics settings for a Web App. Once the diagnostics settings
are configured, Adam then demonstrates how to use the Application Insights
features to monitor Web App resources.
episodes.title: Diagnostics, Monitoring and Analytics Part 4

episodes.description:
Adam and Cherokee discuss how to use Visual Studio 2017 to enable
profiling of a Web App. Adam also demonstrates how to enable remote debugging of
a Web App using Visual Studio. Adam uses the Azure Portal to demonstrate the
Metrics Explorer functionality of the Application Insights feature, as well as
the Insights Analytics Portal for querying of aggregated Application Insight data.
episodes.title: Diagnostics, Monitoring and Analytics Part 5

episodes.description: Adam and Wes discuss how to use Microsoft Operations Management Suite (OMS) workspaces.
episodes.title: Diagnostics Monitoring and Analytics - OMS

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss how to use the Traffic Manage Profiles to configure Web App endpoint monitoring. Adam use the Azure Portal to configure a Traffic Manager Profile and add a Web App end point for monitoring.
episodes.title: Configure Web Apps for Scale and Resilience

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss how to use the AutoScale feature to scale out a Web App.
episodes.title: Configure Web Apps for Scale and Resilience Pt.2

topics.title: Design and Implement Azure App Service Apps

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss Azure Active Directory. Adam explains what Azure Active Directory is and how it can be used in either a Cloud-only or Hybrid deployment solution linked to an on-premise ADDS deployment. Adam uses the Azure Portal to examine the Azure Active Directory infrastructure and also discusses what Azure Active Directory Domain Services are.
episodes.title: Manage Azure Active Directory

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss Azure Active Directory. Adam explains what Azure Active Directory is and how it can be used in either a Cloud-only or Hybrid deployment solution linked to an on-premise ADDS deployment. Adam uses the Azure Portal to examine the Azure Active Directory infrastructure and also discusses what the Security and Activity Blades are used for. Conditional Access settings and Multi-Factor Authentication setup are discussed. The sign-in and audit log reporting functions are also examined.
episodes.title: Manage Azure Active Directory Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss Azure Active Directory. Adam explains what Azure Active Directory is and how it can be used in either a Cloud-only or Hybrid deployment solution linked to an on-premise ADDS deployment. Adam uses the Azure Portal to examine the Azure Active Directory infrastructure and also discusses the Azure AD Connect tool.
episodes.title: Manage Azure Active Directory - AD Connect Tool

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss Azure Active Directory. Adam explains what Azure Active Directory is and how it can be used in either a Cloud-only or Hybrid deployment solution linked to an on-premise ADDS deployment. Adam uses the Azure Portal to examine the Azure Active Directory infrastructure and also discusses the Azure AD Connect tool. Adam demonstrates the setup and configuration of the Azure AD Connect tool.
episodes.title: Manage Azure Active Directory - AD Connect Tool 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss Azure Active Directory. Adam explains what Azure Active Directory is and how it can be used in either a Cloud-only or Hybrid deployment solution linked to an on-premise ADDS deployment. Adam discusses the Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) Connect Health agent and what it is used for. Adam demonstrates the use of the agent in the Azure Health Portal.
episodes.title: Manage Azure Active Directory - AD Connect Tool 3

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss Azure Active Directory. Adam explains what Azure Active Directory is and how it can be used in either a Cloud-only or Hybrid deployment solution linked to an on-premise ADDS deployment. Adam discusses the Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) Connect Health agent and what it is used for. Adam demonstrates the use of the agent in the Azure Health Portal.
episodes.title: Manage Azure Active Directory - AD Connect Tool 4

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss Azure Active Directory. Adam explains what Azure Active Directory Domain Services are and what it is used for. Adam demonstrates how to install and configure Azure ADDS.
episodes.title: Manage Azure Active Directory - ADDS

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss Azure Active Directory. Adam explains what Azure Active Directory Domain Services are and what it is used for. Adam demonstrates how to monitor Azure ADDS. Adam also discusses how to enable NTLM and Kerberos password hash synch using a PowerShell script to ensure that Azure ADDS admin credentials are available for use when attempting to Domain Join an Azure based VM to the Azure AD.
episodes.title: Manage Azure Active Directory - ADDS 2

episodes.description:
Adam and Daniel discuss Azure Active Directory. Adam demonstrates how Domain Join works with a Windows 10 VM running in Azure. Adam also uses a Windows Server 2016 VM that has been joined to the Azure AD domain to demonstrate various administrative functions and capabilities available once a machine has been domain joined, such as DNS management, Group policy management and the use
of the ADAC tool.
episodes.title: Manage Azure Active Directory - Domain Join

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what the Microsoft Graph API is and how to leverage it.
episodes.title: Manage Azure Active Directory - Graph API

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss how to create a Red Hat Enterprise Linux VM and then use Azure AD join to join it to the existing Azure AD.
episodes.title: Manage Azure Active Directory - Linux Domain Join

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss how to set up self-service password reset in Azure AD.
episodes.title: Manage Azure Active Directory - Password Reset

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss Azure AD B2B collaboration.
episodes.title: Manage Azure Active Directory - AD B2B

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what Azure Active Directory B2C is and why you would want to create an instance. Adam demonstrates how to install the Azure Active Directory B2C instance using the Azure Portal.
episodes.title: Manage Azure Active Directory - AD B2C

episodes.description: Adam and Cherokee discuss what Azure Active Directory B2C is and why you would want to create an instance. Adam demonstrates how to work with applications in the Azure B2C instance.
episodes.title: Manage Azure Active Directory - AD B2C 2

episodes.description: Adam and Wes discuss how to implement Enterprise State Roaming.
episodes.title: Manage Azure AD - Enterprise State Roaming

episodes.description: Adam and Wes discuss how to implement Azure Managed Service Identity.
episodes.title: Manage Azure AD - Managed Service Identity

episodes.description: Adam and Wes discuss how to implement Privileged Identity Management.
episodes.title: Manage Azure AD - Privileged Identity Management

episodes.description: Adam and Wes discuss how to implement Azure AD Identity Management.
episodes.title: Manage Azure AD - Azure Identity Management

episodes.description: Adam and Wes discuss how to implement Azure AD Identity Management.
episodes.title: Manage Azure AD - Azure Identity Management Pt.2
